docs.lead_paragraph: A study of extremely obese women who had undergone gastric bypass surgery showed that several who had had polycystic ovarian syndrome were able to conceive within three years of the operation.

headline.seo: Gastric Bypass Surgery May Help Counter Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome
headline.main: Pregnancy: Weight-Loss Surgery May Affect Fertility
headline.print_headline: PATTERN: Weight-Loss Surgery May Affect Fertility

docs.snippet: A study of extremely obese women who had undergone gastric bypass surgery showed that several who had had polycystic ovarian syndrome were able to conceive within three years of the operation.

docs.lead_paragraph: The ongoing discussion about “Torn: True Stories of Kids, Career & the Conflict of Modern Motherhood” and the announcement of the creation of the Fathers Forum both led readers to ask versions of the same question in the comments: Can we assume mothers to be different from fathers? If they are not, then what institutional, social and historical obstacles are to blame for reinforcing unequal roles and expectations? And if they are, then how? And what do those differences mean institutionally, socially and historically?
docs.abstract: If they are not, then what institutional, social and historical obstacles are to blame for reinforcing unequal roles and expectations?
docs.snippet: If they are not, then what institutional, social and historical obstacles are to blame for reinforcing unequal roles and expectations?

docs.lead_paragraph: Eleanor Henderson’s fierce, elegiac novel follows a group of friends, lovers, parents and children through the straight-edge music scene and the early days of the AIDS epidemic.

headline.seo: Book Review - Ten Thousand Saints - By Eleanor Henderson

docs.snippet: Eleanor Henderson’s fierce, elegiac novel follows a group of friends, lovers, parents and children through the straight-edge music scene and the early days of the AIDS epidemic.

docs.lead_paragraph: You don’t become a parent until you have a child. No class can really prepare you, and no conversation can truly make you ready. That said, having a child is just the start. What you think you know the moment they are born will change by the hour.
docs.abstract: Learning on the job, in unexpected ways.
docs.snippet: Learning on the job, in unexpected ways.
